item.title: Rice returns for West Ham as Weghorst starts for Man Utd LIVE!
English side in trouble as players consider going on a strike – could refuse to play the final game of the season
item.description:
Wigan players are considering going on a strike and refusing to play the last game of the season, according to the latest report from The Sun.

The report claims that the players did not attend training on Saturday after failing to receive all their wages on Friday. And they could now refuse to return to play the final game of the season for the Latics.

The report further adds that some of the players have since then been paid but all those players who are out of contract this summer have still not been paid. It also claims that the players are ‘openly discussing‘ a strike until all outstanding payments are made.

Wigan Athletic’s Bahraini owners have promised to make payments after their game on Monday, but this has failed to appease the disgruntled players.

If the first team players do not show up, Wigan will have to make do with their reserves do field a team against Rotherham United.

Wigan chairman Talal Al Hammad has failed to pay the players in time for the 5th time this season
More Stories / Latest News
English side in trouble as players consider going on a strike – could refuse to play the final game of the season
May 7 2023, 17:42
Spurs could retain defender who has played 32 times this season
May 7 2023, 17:28
Video: Netherlands goalkeeper Jasper Cillessen left red-faced after making the blunder of the season
May 7 2023, 16:55

This is the 5th time they have failed to pay the players and staff their salaries this season and have already been punished with a 3 point deduction for failing to pay them in time last month.

The situation at Wigan Athletic is undoubtedly concerning. It remains to be seen whether the players will go through with their threatened strike, but their grievances are understandable given the club’s repeated failure to meet its financial obligations to its staff.

The post English side in trouble as players consider going on a strike – could refuse to play the final game of the season appeared first on CaughtOffside.
item.dc:creator: Mehdi Gokal

item.title: Burnley boss Kompany signs new five-year deal
item.description: Burnley manager Vincent Kompany has signed a new contract that will keep him at Turf Moor until at least 2028.

Man Utd identify £53m Harry Maguire replacement who had to apologise for outburst
item.description: Harry Maguire has found himself fifth-choice centre-back at Manchester United, with Erik ten Hag now looking to sign a replacement in the summer transfer window

item.title: WSL: Daly hits hat-trick as Villa rout Reading | Brighton beat West Ham
item.description: Rachel Daly scored a hat-trick as Aston Villa sent Reading closer to relegation from the WSL with a 5-0 thrashing.

item.title: West Ham vs Man Utd team news LIVE!
Liverpool in talks to bring in German Jörg Schmadtke as sporting director
item.description:
• Schmadtke left Wolfsburg in February after four years
  • Busy summer transfer window expected at Anfield

Liverpool are in talks to hire Jörg Schmadtke as the club’s sporting director. If the German, who has worked for Wolfsburg, takes up a role at Liverpool, he will become a key member of the transfer committee for what will be an important summer of recruitment.

Liverpool have been looking for a permanent replacement for the incumbent, Julian Ward, who will leave at the end of the season. Ward only replaced his predecessor Michael Edwards last summer but announced in November that he would depart at the conclusion of the current campaign.

Continue reading...
item.dc:creator: Will Unwin

item.title: Vincent Kompany ends speculation by signing five-year deal with Burnley
item.description:
• Manager was linked with Chelsea and Tottenham
  • Kompany: ‘We have made Turf Moor a fortress again’

Vincent Kompany has seemingly ended speculation regarding him taking charge at Tottenham or Chelsea next season by signing a new five-year contract with Burnley.

The former Manchester City defender has reportedly attracted interest from the two London clubs having done an excellent job in his first season in charge at Turf Moor. Burnley secured promotion back to the Premier League as Championship champions having played excellent football throughout the campaign.

Continue reading...
item.dc:creator: PA Media

item.title: Spurs could retain defender who has played 32 times this season
item.description:
Tottenham are said to be interested in keeping defender Clement Lenglet for next season but only if the price is a reasonable one.

This is according to Sport, whose report comes amid several rumours over Lenglet and his future in London.

The Frenchman has been on loan at Spurs this season from Barcelona and has made 32 appearances in all competitions for the club as they currently sit 6th in the table.

Under Antonio Conte, Lenglet made 27 appearances in the Italian’s back-three system and despite the team’s recent rough run of form, the club may look to keep him for another 12 months, per Mundo Deportivo.

Lenglet’s time at Spurs has been eventful

Spanish journalist Gerard Romero said on his Twitch stream – according to SpursWeb – earlier in the week that Tottenham were in an advanced position over a £10.5million deal for the 27-year old, but how far that deal has progressed since that news is unclear.

[morestoeries latest]

For the price mentioned by Romero, the movie wouldn’t be a bad one by Spurs but with the club still managerless, the French player’s future at the club could come into further question this summer.

The post Spurs could retain defender who has played 32 times this season appeared first on CaughtOffside.
item.dc:creator: Luka Foley

item.title: Rangers 1-0 Aberdeen: Todd Cantwell volley dents visitors' European push
item.description: Todd Cantwell's volley gets Rangers back to winning ways and dents Aberdeen's push to seal third place in the Scottish Premiership.

item.title: Vincent Kompany: Burnley boss signs five-year deal after winning Championship title
item.description: Burnley boss Vincent Kompany signs a new five-year deal to remain with the Championship title winners until the summer of 2028.

item.title: Hearts 0-2 Celtic: Ange Postecoglou's side seal back-to-back titles
item.description: Celtic clinch their second successive Scottish Premiership title under Ange Postecoglou as Kyogo Furuhashi's 30th goal of the season helps overcome stubborn 10-man Hearts at Tynecastle.

item.title: Cantwell screamer edges Rangers to win over Aberdeen
item.description: Todd Cantwell's stunning second-half volley was enough to help Rangers to a 1-0 win over Aberdeen at Ibrox.

item.title: 'Free all Saudi prisoners' banner flies over St James' Park as Newcastle face Arsenal
item.description: A banner reading 'Free all Saudi prisoners' was flown over St James Park as Newcastle hosted Arsenal in the Premier League on Sunday.

item.title: Rangers 1-0 Aberdeen: Michael Beale's side return to winning ways thanks to Todd Cantwell's volley
item.description: The breakthrough came in the in the 65th minute through Todd Cantwell's superb volley following a deep corner from James Tavernier.

item.title: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang 'looking to terminate his Chelsea deal' to facilitate Barcelona return
item.description: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is looking to terminate his Chelsea contract to facilitate a summer move to Barcelona, according to a new report.

item.title: Hearts 0-2 Celtic: Ange Postecoglou's side secure back-to-back Scottish Premiership titles
item.description: STEPHEN MCGOWAN AT TYNECASTLE PARK: As so often Furuhashi made the difference, nicking across a defender to score his seventh goal in nine wins over Hearts.

item.title: Virgil van Dijk praises Liverpool's 'big leader' Jurgen Klopp made special shirt for
item.description: Alisson Becker notched his 100th clean sheet in Liverpool colours against Brentford in the Premier League with Virgil van Dijk and Jurgen Klopp paying tribute to the goalkeeper
item.dc:creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (David Maddock)

item.title: Ex-Premier League star now owns luxury Marbella bar - hosting Erling Haaland and Katie Price
item.description: Former Tottenham, Newcastle and Birmingham full-back Stephen Carr now runs a chain of bars, restaurants and nightclubs in Spain, having been forced to retire in 2013 due to a knee injury
item.dc:creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Matthew Cooper)
